{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking which vessel is not ligated for epistaxis control. The documents describe various methods of treatment for epistaxis, including anterior and posterior tamponade, ligature of the sphenopalatine artery, internal maxillary arterial ligation, and combined internal maxillary and anterior ethmoidal arterial coagulation. Based on this information, it appears that the external carotid aery is not ligated in case of epistaxis control, as it is mentioned to be generally ineffective.", "answer_choice": D}
